TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit DashStyles extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Implements a set of predefined objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following illustration shows examples of different dash styles applied to an underline. ![Shows several different dash styles.](../../add/media/graphicsdashstyles.gif "Shows several different dash styles.") ## XAML Text Usage You cannot declare this managed class in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], but you can use its static properties to assign values in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](../../add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].

Docs.summary: Gets a with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.DashStyle.Dashes%2A> property equal to `2`,`2`.
Docs.value: A dash sequence of 2,2, which describes a sequence composed of a dash that is twice as long as the pen <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness%2A> followed by a space that is twice as long as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following illustration shows examples of different dash styles applied to an underline. ![Shows several different dash styles.](../../add/media/graphicsdashstyles.gif "Shows several different dash styles.") ## XAML Attribute Usage <*object* *property* ="{ `DashStyles.Dash`}"/>

Docs.returns: A dash sequence of 2,2, which describes a sequence composed of a dash that is twice as long as the pen <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness%2A> followed by a space that is twice as long as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Pen.Thickness%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets a with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.DashStyle.Dashes%2A> property equal to `2`,`2`,`0`,`2`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following illustration shows examples of different dash styles applied to an underline. ![Shows several different dash styles.](../../add/media/graphicsdashstyles.gif "Shows several different dash styles.") ## XAML Attribute Usage <*object* *property* ="{ `DashStyles.DashDot`}"/>

Docs.summary: Gets a with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.DashStyle.Dashes%2A> property equal to `2`,`2`,`0`,`2`,`0`,`2`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following illustration shows examples of different dash styles applied to an underline. ![Shows several different dash styles.](../../add/media/graphicsdashstyles.gif "Shows several different dash styles.") ## XAML Attribute Usage <*object* *property* ="{ `DashStyles.DashDotDot`}"/>

Docs.summary: Gets a with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.DashStyle.Dashes%2A> property equal to `0`,`2`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The following illustration shows examples of different dash styles applied to an underline. ![Shows several different dash styles.](../../add/media/graphicsdashstyles.gif "Shows several different dash styles.") ## XAML Attribute Usage <*object* *property* ="{ `DashStyles.Dot`}"/>

Docs.summary: Gets a with an empty <xref:System.Windows.Media.DashStyle.Dashes%2A> property.
Docs.value: A dash sequence with no dashes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property produces a solid line and is equivalent to not defining a dash sequence. The following illustration shows examples of different dash styles applied to an underline. ![Shows several different dash styles.](../../add/media/graphicsdashstyles.gif "Shows several different dash styles.") ## XAML Attribute Usage <*object* *property* ="{ `DashStyles.Solid`}"/>

Docs.returns: A dash sequence with no dashes.
